commit.message: feat: Created builder class for java properties
feat: Created test to verify all properties accounted for in new file

nodes.bodyText: We are only using the Jetbrains annotations.
I would look into using reflection or something to get all of the properties. How can we be sure it has all the properties?
We need a lot more verifications then just property names. Everything attached to the property should be checked.

These should have the public final modifier on them as well.
public so we can access them through reflection (https://stackoverflow.com/a/14078769). This will help with the tests as well.
final so the variables cannot be overridden.
Also are you using any of these imports in this class?

commit.message: feat: Altered test to collect properties from DetectPropertiesJava using reflection
feat: Replaced usages of DetectProperties.kt with java equivalent
feat: Replaced usages of kotlin detect properties with Java equivalent
feat: Resolved syntax to support new java properties
refactor(properties): Cleaned up code smells. Suppressed warnings we don't care about. Applied formatting.
fix: Fixed errant property fields, added category check in PropertyVerificationTest.
